children.name: Cyber event
children.description: represent non-persistent cyber actions and effects as opposed to persistent cyber objects.
children.label: Cyber event

children.name: Cyber acknowledge
children.description: Cyber Acknowledge represents a response to a Cyber Event that has requested an acknowledgement.
children.label: Cyber acknowledge

children.name: Cyber action
children.description: A Cyber Action is the fact or process of doing something, in or through cyberspace, typically to achieve an aim. [Lexico, adapted] Cyber Action is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct; specific effects are instantiated as subclasses.
children.label: Cyber action

children.name: Cyber admin
children.description: Cyber Admin are actions that are administrative in nature and performed by authorized actors.
children.label: Cyber admin

children.name: Cyber attack
children.description: Techniques represent how an adversary achieves a tactical goal by performing an action. Sub-techniques are a more specific description of the adversarial behavior used to achieve a goal. They describe behavior at a lower level than a technique. Techniques are identified by “T####” and sub-techniques are indicated by the “.###” notation. [ATT&CK v13]
children.label: Cyber attack

children.name: Data exfiltration
children.description:
Data Exfiltration is the unauthorized copying, transfer or retrieval of data from a computer or server. Data exfiltration is a malicious activity performed through various different techniques, typically by cybercriminals over the Internet or other network. [Techopedia] Data Exfiltration is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
CyberEvent.Target identifies the data being exfiltrated. CyberEvent.ActorID identifies the actor performing the exfiltration.
children.label: Data exfiltration

children.name: Manipulation attack
children.description: A Manipulation Attack controls or changes information, information systems, and/or networks to create physical denial effects, using deception, decoying, conditioning, spoofing, falsification, and other similar techniques. [JP3-12] Manipulation Attack is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Manipulation attack

children.name: Phishing attack
children.description: A Phishing Attack is the fraudulent practice of sending messages purporting to be from reputable sources in order to induce individuals to reveal sensitive information or unknowingly initiate another attack.
children.label: Phishing attack

children.name: Cyber defend
children.description:
Cyber Defend is a cyberspace action taken within protected cyberspace to defeat specific threats that have breached or are threatening to breach the cyberspace security measures and include actions to detect, characterize, counter, and mitigate threats, including malware or the unauthorized activities of users, and to restore the system to a secure configuration. [JP3-12]
Mitigations represent security concepts and classes of technologies that can be used to prevent a technique or sub-technique from being successfully executed. Mitigations are identified by “M####” notation. [ATT&CK v13]
children.label: Cyber defend

children.name: Cyber recon
children.description: The detect tactic is used to identify adversary access to or unauthorized activity on computer networks. Detect techniques format D3-xxxxx, where “xxx” are the first letters in the technique’s name. [D3FEND]
children.label: Cyber recon

children.name: Cyber effect
children.description: A Cyber Effect is a change, in or through cyberspace, which is a result or consequence of an action or other cause. [Lexico, adapted] Cyber Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct; specific effects are instantiated as subclasses. Cyber Effect is further decomposed into deny (degrade, destroy, and disrupt) and manipulate consistent with US Joint Publication 3-12 [JP3-12] and detect.
children.label: Cyber effect

children.name: Deny
children.description: Deny represents preventing access to, operation of, or availability of a target function by a specified level for a specified time, by degrade, disrupt, or destroy. Deny is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct; specific effects are instantiated as subclasses.
children.label: Deny

children.name: Degrade
children.description: Degrade represets denying access to, or operation of, a target to a level represented as a percentage of capacity. [JP3-12]
children.label: Degrade

children.name: CPU load effect
children.description: CPU Load Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: CPU load effect

children.name: Delay effect
children.description: Delay Effect represents the increased time for data to travel between two points.
children.label: Delay effect

children.name: Drop effect
children.description: Drop Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Drop effect

children.name: Hardware degrade effect
children.description: Hardware Degrade Effect represents the degradation but not destruction of hardware.
children.label: Hardware degrade effect

children.name: Jitter effect
children.description: Jitter Effect represents the variance in time delay in milliseconds (ms) between data packets over a network; a disruption in the normal sequence of sending data packets.
children.label: Jitter effect

children.name: Load rate effect
children.description: Load Rate Effect represents the impact on data upload or download rate.
children.label: Load rate effect

children.name: Memory use effect
children.description: Memory Use Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Memory use effect

children.name: Other degrade effect
children.description: Other Degrade Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct for representing a generic degradation effect.
children.label: Other degrade effect

children.name: Destroy
children.description: Destroy represents completely and irreparably denying access to, or operation of, a target. [JP3-12] Destroy is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct; specific effects are instantiated as subclasses.
children.label: Destroy

children.name: Hardware damage effect
children.description: Hardware Damage Effect represents physical damage to a device.
children.label: Hardware damage effect

children.name: Disrupt
children.description: Disrupt represents completely but temporarily denying access to, or operation of, a target for a period of time. [JP3-12] Disrupt is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct; specific effects are instantiated as subclasses.
children.label: Disrupt

children.name: Block traffic effect
children.description: Block Traffic Effect represents completely blocking all traffic over a communication channel. Block Traffic Effect is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Block traffic effect

children.name: Detect
children.description: Detect represents discovering or discerning the existence, presence, or fact of an intrusion into information systems. [ATT&CK v13]
children.label: Detect

children.name: Manipulate
children.description: Manipulate represents the effect of controlling or changing information, information systems, and/or networks to create physical denial effects, using deception, decoying, conditioning, spoofing, falsification, and other similar techniques. [JP3-12] Manipulate is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Manipulate

children.name: Manipulation effect
children.description: A Manipulation Effect describes the type, effected information/system/network, and/or extent (as a percentage) of the manipulation attack.
children.label: Manipulation effect

children.name: Cyber order
children.description: Cyber Order captures cyberspace related command and control orders/directives. Cyber Order is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct. The commander will need a persona to be represented in the Actor ID. If the order is directed at live subordinates, they will need to have personas to be the targets of the order. The content of the orders is represented in the Target Modifiers.
children.label: Cyber order

children.name: KeyValuePair
children.description: Key Value Pairs are for specifying additional criteria for targets and Detect Acquired Information.

children.name: TimeStruct
children.description: Time Struct is a placeholder for simulation time specified in a federation-specific format.

children.name: MitreID
children.description: A (String) ID from the MITRE ATT&CK or D3FEND matrix. Sub-technique IDs are formatted as T####.###. Mitigation IDs are formatted as M####. Detection IDs are formatted as D3-xxxxx.

children.name: NetworkInterfaceStruct
children.description: Network Interface Struct represents a network interface, hardware and/or software, that enables a device to connect to a network link. A network interface can exist with or without a link, but not without a device.

children.name: Cyber object
children.description: Cyber objects will provide additional information for simulation entities and will be sent at heartbeat intervals similar to Entity State PDUs to indicate persistence.
children.label: Cyber object

children.name: Application
children.description: Application represents a specific instance of a software program running on a device. Running processes are considered to be members of this class. At rest applications are considered to be members of the Data class with Data Type Code.
children.label: Application

children.name: Operating system
children.description: Operating System represents the software that supports a computer's basic functions, such as scheduling tasks, executing applications, and controlling peripherals.
children.label: Operating system

children.name: Service
children.description: Service represents an application that provides a service to network clients.
children.label: Service

children.name: Data
children.description: Data represents information encapsulated in an instance or collection of file(s), message(s), or record(s) in a database. Data can represent a specific information object or a kind of information, e.g. a specific tactical message or messages that contain SPOTREP information. CyberObject.Name is the filename, subject, information kind, etc. At rest applications are considered to be members of this class with Data Type Code. Running processes are considered to be members of the Application class.
children.label: Data

children.name: Communication data
children.description: Communications Data represents data on a communications channel/stream.
children.label: Communication data

children.name: Device
children.description: Device represents an electronic device capable of operating in cyberspace.
children.label: Device

children.name: Network
children.description: Network represents a data network including LANs, WANs, tactical radio data networks, cellular data networks, etc.; networks can be composed of other networks, e.g. a WAN is a collection of LANs. CyberObject.Name is the domain name or subnet address range.
children.label: Network

children.name: Network link
children.description: Network Link represents a physical or logical data link or bus between two or more devices.
children.label: Network link

children.name: Logical network link
children.description: Logical Network Link represents a logical data link (or bus) between two or more devices. Logical Network Link is an abstract class intended as an organizational construct.
children.label: Logical network link

children.name: Physical network link
children.description: Physical Network Link represents physical data link (or bus) between two or more devices.
children.label: Physical network link

children.name: Persona
children.description: Persona represents a user or profile for a person within cyberspace. CyberObject.Name is the username, email address, etc. Persona is currently a placeholder and organizational construct for identifying personae. It has no attributes.
children.label: Persona

children.name: System
children.description: System represents a collection of Cyber Objects, i.e. components and / or subsystems, that work together.
children.label: System

children.name: RelatedObjectStruct
children.description: Related Object Struct describes properties about a relationship between objects.

children.name: Enumerations
children.description: The following are the Cyber DEM enumerations at the time the standard was completed. Updates to the enumeration values may occur between versions of the standard via the Enumerations SWG. See the latest version of SISO-REF-010 for the current values.

children.name: AdminTypeAdministration
children.description: Installation, configuration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of systems, networks, data, or accounts.
children.label: Administration

children.name: AdminTypeAssessment
children.description: Determining deviations from acceptable configurations, enterprise, or local policy; determining level of risk; analysis of operational and technical security controls.
children.label: Assessment

children.name: AdminTypeCollection
children.description: Collection of data located on the network or system(s) for the purposes of intelligence, assessment, or planning.
children.label: Collection

children.name: AdminTypeConfiguration
children.description: Making changes to system, software, security, or network settings.
children.label: Configuration

children.name: AdminTypeEvaluation
children.description: Analyzing systems for compliance with specifications and requirements.
children.label: Evaluation

children.name: AdminTypeForensics
children.description: Collection, processing, preservation, and/or analysis of computer-related evidence in support of network vulnerability mitigation and/or criminal, fraud, counterintelligence, or law enforcement investigations.
children.label: Forensics

children.name: AdminTypeInvestigation
children.description: Analyze information technology (IT) or cybersecurity events related to systems, networks, and digital evidence.
children.label: Investigation

children.name: AdminTypeOperations
children.description: Support, administration, or maintenance necessary to ensure effective and efficient information technology (IT) system performance and security.
children.label: Operations

children.name: AdminTypeProvisioning
children.description: Procuring or building IT systems.
children.label: Provisioning

children.name: AdminTypeTesting
children.description: Execution of all or part of a system to evaluate and verify compliance with specifications or requirements.
children.label: Testing

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeCancel
children.description: The cyber event is cancelled regardless of it's current phase.
children.label: Cancel

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeContinue
children.description: Resume paused cyber event.
children.label: Continue

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeContinueWithChanges
children.description: Resume paused cyber event with changes to parameters.
children.label: Continue with changes

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeEnd
children.description: End cyber event regardless of remaining duration.
children.label: End

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeStart
children.description: Initiate cyber event.
children.label: Start

children.name: CyberEventPhaseTypeSuspend
children.description: Pause cyber event.
children.label: Suspend

children.name: DataLinkProtocolType1553Bus
children.description: MIL-STD-1553 multiplex data bus system.
children.label: 1553 bus

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeATM
children.description: Asynchronous transfer mode.
children.label: ATM

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeBluetooth
children.description: A short-range wireless technology standard that is used for exchanging data between fixed and mobile devices and building personal area networks (PANs).
children.label: Bluetooth

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeEthernet
children.description: IEEE 802.3 networking protocol (based on the Carrier Sense Multiple Access/Collision Detection CSMA/CD protocol), used for connected devices in a wired LAN or WAN.
children.label: Ethernet

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeLLC
children.description: Logical Link Control.
children.label: LLC

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeLocalTalk
children.description: A particular implementation of the physical layer of the AppleTalk networking system from Apple Computer.
children.label: LocalTalk

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypePPP
children.description: Point-to-point protocol.
children.label: PPP

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeTokenRing
children.description: IEEE 802.5, a local area network (LAN) topology that sends data in one direction throughout a specified number of locations by using a token.
children.label: Token Ring

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeVLAN
children.description: Virtual local area network.
children.label: VLAN

children.name: DataLinkProtocolTypeWiFi
children.description: A capability allowing computers, smartphones, or other devices to connect to the internet or communicate with one another wirelessly within a particular area.
children.label: WiFi

children.name: DataStatusTypeCompromised
children.description: Data has been modified or accessed without authorization.
children.label: Compromised

children.name: DataStatusTypeCorrupted
children.description: Data integrity is lost.
children.label: Corrupted

children.name: DataStatusTypeErased
children.description: Data was deleted and is irretrievable.
children.label: Erased

children.name: DataStatusTypeIntact
children.description: Data is complete, not damaged or impaired in any way.
children.label: Intact

children.name: DataStatusTypeManipulated
children.description: Data has been altered (by unauthorized means).
children.label: Manipulated

children.name: DataStatusTypeNonDecryptable
children.description: Data is encrypted and not accessible by authorized users.
children.label: Non decryptable

children.name: DataTypeCode
children.description: File in binary format.
children.label: Code

children.name: DataTypeCommunications
children.description: Data in motion through a communications channel.
children.label: Communications

children.name: DataTypeCredentials
children.description: File with authentication data, e.g., PKI keys, hashed passwords.
children.label: Credentials

children.name: DataTypeFile
children.description: File in human readable format.
children.label: File

children.name: DataTypeSystemConfiguration
children.description: A system's configuration data (e.g., MS Windows Registry database).
children.label: System configuration

children.name: DeviceTypeCommunications
children.description: Device that performs non-computer communications, e.g. radio, telephone, cellular.
children.label: Communications

children.name: DeviceTypeComputerNode
children.description: General purpose computer, e.g. a server or desktop.
children.label: Computer node

children.name: DeviceTypeController
children.description: Device used to control another device, e.g. a storage device controller.
children.label: Controller

children.name: DeviceTypeGeneric
children.description: General device with logic bearing components.
children.label: Generic

children.name: DeviceTypeHMI
children.description: Human machine interface; devices through which the user interacts with a computer system.
children.label: HMI

children.name: DeviceTypeIoT
children.description: Internet of things; device that uses internet protocols for communications, command and control.
children.label: IoT

children.name: DeviceTypeMonitoring
children.description: Software that inspects digital actions, e.g. Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS).
children.label: Monitoring

children.name: DeviceTypeNetworking
children.description: Includes routers, switches, VPN concentrators.
children.label: Networking

children.name: DeviceTypePortableComputer
children.description: Computer that is mobile, e.g. a laptop or tablet.
children.label: Portable computer

children.name: DeviceTypePrinter
children.description: Device for producing printed output including paper and 3D materials.
children.label: Printer

children.name: DeviceTypeScanner
children.description: Device for producing a digital representation of a physical item, e.g. printed material, fingerprint, facial recognition, highway toll readers.
children.label: Scanner

children.name: DeviceTypeSecurity
children.description: Device that provides security functions to the system.
children.label: Security

children.name: DeviceTypeSensor
children.description: Device that reports certain conditions, e.g. environmental, operating status.
children.label: Sensor

children.name: DeviceTypeStorage
children.description: Non-volatile memory device, e.g. thumb drive, solid-state drive, serial advanced technology attachment.
children.label: Storage

children.name: EncryptionTypeAES
children.description: Advanced Encryption Standard.
children.label: AES

children.name: EncryptionTypeDES
children.description: Data Encryption Standard.
children.label: DES

children.name: EncryptionTypeNotEncrypted
children.description: No encryption used.
children.label: Not encrypted

children.name: EncryptionTypeRSA
children.description: Rivest Shamir Adleman.
children.label: RSA

children.name: EncryptionTypeTripleDES
children.description: Triple DES.
children.label: Triple DES

children.name: EncryptionTypeTwoFish
children.description: TwoFish encryption.
children.label: TwoFish

children.name: HardwareDamageTypeBootLoop
children.description: Repeated, uninterruptable rebooting.
children.label: Boot loop

children.name: HardwareDamageTypeHardDriveErased
children.description: Hard drive is not readable, e.g. zeroized or file allocation table erased.
children.label: Hard drive erased

children.name: HardwareDamageTypePhysicalDestruction
children.description: Physical damage to hardware, e.g. overheating.
children.label: Physical destruction

children.name: HardwareDegradeTypeDisplay
children.description: Display inoperable or unreadable.
children.label: Display

children.name: HardwareDegradeTypeKeyboard
children.description: Keyboard inoperable or degraded performance.
children.label: Keyboard

children.name: HardwareDegradeTypeMouse
children.description: Mouse inoperable or degraded performance.
children.label: Mouse

children.name: HardwareDegradeTypeSound
children.description: Sound inoperable.
children.label: Sound

children.name: LoadRateTypeDownload
children.description: Slow download from the target.
children.label: Download

children.name: LoadRateTypeUpload
children.description: Slow upload toward the target.
children.label: Upload

children.name: ManipulationTypeDatabase
children.description: Database records.
children.label: Database

children.name: ManipulationTypeFile
children.description: Files on a drive/system.
children.label: File

children.name: ManipulationTypePacket
children.description: Communications packets.
children.label: Packet

children.name: MessageTypeChat
children.description: Two way non-voice communication through an application hosted on any device.
children.label: Chat

children.name: MessageTypeEmail
children.description: Contents of an email.
children.label: Email

children.name: MessageTypeSocialMedia
children.description: Data published on a social media platform.
children.label: Social media

children.name: MessageTypeText
children.description: Two way non-voice communication through a cellular device.
children.label: Text

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeARP
children.description: Address Resolution Protocol.
children.label: ARP

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeICMP
children.description: Internet Control Message Protocol.
children.label: ICMP

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeIPsec
children.description: Internet Protocol Security.
children.label: IPsec

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeInternetProtocol
children.description: Internet protocol.
children.label: Internet protocol

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeNAT
children.description: Network address translation.
children.label: NAT

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeOSPF
children.description: Open Shortest Path First.
children.label: OSPF

children.name: NetworkProtocolTypeRIP
children.description: Routing Information Protocol.
children.label: RIP

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeAndroid
children.description: Google's mobile phone OS.
children.label: Android

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeAppleIOS
children.description: Apple's mobile phone OS.
children.label: Apple iOS

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeAppleMacOS
children.description: Apple's OS with a windowing UI.
children.label: Apple macOS

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeCiscoIOS
children.description: Cisco's OS for routers and switches.
children.label: Cisco IOS

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeDECVMS
children.description: Digital Equipment Corporation Virtual Memory System.
children.label: DEC VMS

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeFirmware
children.description: Hardware control software.
children.label: Firmware

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeIBMOS2
children.description: International Business Machines OS/2.
children.label: IBM OS/2

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeMicrosoftDOS
children.description: Microsoft's Disk Operating System.
children.label: Microsoft DOS

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeMicrosoftWindows
children.description: Microsoft's OS with a windowing UI.
children.label: Microsoft Windows

children.name: OperatingSystemTypeUNIXLinux
children.description: Any *nix operating system.
children.label: UNIX-Linux

children.name: PacketManipulationTypeCorruption
children.description: Manipulating data within the packet.
children.label: Corruption

children.name: PacketManipulationTypeDropped
children.description: Preventing packets from reaching the destination.
children.label: Dropped

children.name: PacketManipulationTypeDuplication
children.description: Sending the same packet again.
children.label: Duplication

children.name: PacketManipulationTypeReordering
children.description: Changing the order of packets.
children.label: Reordering

children.name: PhysicalLayerTypeWired
children.description: Wired, e.g., ethernet.
children.label: Wired

children.name: PhysicalLayerTypeWireless
children.description: Wireless, e.g., IEEE 802.11.
children.label: Wireless

children.name: ReconTypeARPScan
children.description: Address Resolution Protocol scan
children.label: ARP scan

children.name: ReconTypeAccountDiscovery
children.description: Identify accounts
children.label: Account discovery

children.name: ReconTypeAdMalware
children.description: Host-based scan
children.label: Ad malware

children.name: ReconTypeAntivirusTrojan
children.description: Host-based scan
children.label: Antivirus trojan

children.name: ReconTypeApplicationWindowDiscovery
children.description: Identify open application windows
children.label: Application window discovery

children.name: ReconTypeBannerGrabbing
children.description: Web application scan
children.label: Banner grabbing

children.name: ReconTypeBounceScan
children.description: Transport layer - TCP scan
children.label: Bounce scan

children.name: ReconTypeBrowserBookmarkDiscovery
children.description: Identify bookmarks
children.label: Browser bookmark discovery

children.name: ReconTypeCSRF
children.description: Cross site request forgery scan
children.label: CSRF

children.name: ReconTypeCloudInfrastructureDiscovery
children.description: Identify resources that are available in an IaaS
children.label: Cloud infrastructure discovery

children.name: ReconTypeCloudServiceDashboard
children.description: Identify resources available via compromised credentials
children.label: Cloud service dashboard

children.name: ReconTypeCloudServiceDiscovery
children.description: Identify cloud services running
children.label: Cloud service discovery

children.name: ReconTypeCompliance
children.description: Host-based scan (PCIDSS, HIPAA, ISO 27001, NIST SP800.53)
children.label: Compliance

children.name: ReconTypeDBManufactureVersion
children.description: Database enumeration
children.label: DB manufacture version

children.name: ReconTypeDNS
children.description: Identify Domain Name System
children.label: DNS

children.name: ReconTypeDatabaseInjection
children.description: Database enumeration (Boolean-based blind, time-based blind, error based, union query, stacked query, out-of-band), scans to test for vulnerabilities not actual exploiting
children.label: Database injection

children.name: ReconTypeDatabaseStructure
children.description: Database enumeration - tables, columns, users, privileges, roles
children.label: Database structure

children.name: ReconTypeDevice
children.description: Identify devices
children.label: Device

children.name: ReconTypeDomain
children.description: Identify domains
children.label: Domain

children.name: ReconTypeDomainTrustDiscovery
children.description: Identify domain trust relationships
children.label: Domain trust discovery

children.name: ReconTypeFINScan
children.description: Transport layer - TCP scan
children.label: FIN scan

children.name: ReconTypeFTP
children.description: File transfer protocol scan
children.label: FTP

children.name: ReconTypeFileAndDirectoryDiscovery
children.description: Identify file and directory structure
children.label: File and directory discovery

children.name: ReconTypeHTTP
children.description: Hyper text transfer protocol scan
children.label: HTTP

children.name: ReconTypeIGMP
children.description: Internet group management protocol scan
children.label: IGMP

children.name: ReconTypeIP
children.description: Internet Protocol scan
children.label: IP

children.name: ReconTypeIdleScan
children.description: Transport layer - TCP scan
children.label: Idle scan

children.name: ReconTypeInputValidation
children.description: Application scan (code injection, fuzzing)
children.label: Input validation

children.name: ReconTypeLDAPScan
children.description: Lightweight directory access protocol scan
children.label: LDAP scan

children.name: ReconTypeNTP
children.description: Network Time Protocol scan
children.label: NTP

children.name: ReconTypeNULLScan
children.description: Transport layer - TCP scan
children.label: NULL scan

children.name: ReconTypeNetBiosScan
children.description: Identify NetBios enabled systems
children.label: NetBIOS scan

children.name: ReconTypeNetworkMap
children.description: Determine topology
children.label: Network map

children.name: ReconTypeNetworkServiceScanning
children.description: Identify network services running
children.label: Network service scanning

children.name: ReconTypeNetworkShareDiscovery
children.description: Identify shared folders and drives
children.label: Network share discovery

children.name: ReconTypeNetworkSniffing
children.description: Capture network traffic for analysis
children.label: Network sniffing

children.name: ReconTypeOSScan
children.description: Identify operating systems
children.label: OS scan

children.name: ReconTypePPP
children.description: Point-to-point protocol scan
children.label: PPP

children.name: ReconTypePasswordPolicyDiscovery
children.description: Identify password policy
children.label: Password policy discovery

children.name: ReconTypePatchHistory
children.description: Host-based scan
children.label: Patch history

children.name: ReconTypePeripheralDeviceDiscovery
children.description: Identify devices connected to a computer system
children.label: Peripheral device discovery

children.name: ReconTypePermissionGroupsDiscovery
children.description: Identify group permissions
children.label: Permission groups discovery

children.name: ReconTypePing
children.description: Single host
children.label: Ping

children.name: ReconTypePingScan
children.description: Multiple host
children.label: Ping scan

children.name: ReconTypePortScan
children.description: Single host, multiple ports
children.label: Port scan

children.name: ReconTypePortSweep
children.description: Multiple hosts, single port
children.label: Port sweep

children.name: ReconTypeProcessDiscovery
children.description: Identify processes running on the system
children.label: Process discovery

children.name: ReconTypeQueryRegistry
children.description: Gather registry information
children.label: Query registry

children.name: ReconTypeRARP
children.description: Reverse address resolution protocol scan
children.label: RARP

children.name: ReconTypeRPCScan
children.description: Remote Procedure Call scan
children.label: RPC scan

children.name: ReconTypeRemoteSystemDiscovery
children.description: Identify remote systems
children.label: Remote system discovery

children.name: ReconTypeRootkit
children.description: Host-based scan
children.label: Rootkit

children.name: ReconTypeSLIP
children.description: Serial line internet protocol scan
children.label: SLIP

children.name: ReconTypeSMTP
children.description: Simple mail transfer protocol scan
children.label: SMTP

children.name: ReconTypeSNMPSweep
children.description: Simple network management protocol scan
children.label: SNMP sweep

children.name: ReconTypeSYNScan
children.description: Transport layer - TCP scan
children.label: SYN scan

children.name: ReconTypeService
children.description: Identify active services
children.label: Service

children.name: ReconTypeSoftwareDiscover
children.description: Identify installed software

children.description: Service that stores and manages data (e.g., RDBMS).

children.name: ServiceTypeForum
children.description: Service that allows users to share information and collaborate about a particular topic.

children.label: Social media

children.label: Virtualization

children.label: Web
